texts.quiz_info_title: How to format a quiz file?
texts.quiz_info_text: The quiz file must be in the .txt or .md format and must be encoded in UTF-8.
texts.quiz_info_1: Questions are added in Markdown format
texts.quiz_info_2: This is how we add answers
texts.quiz_info_3: And this is how we mark the correct one
texts.quiz_info_4: This is how we add explanations to questions
texts.quiz_info_5: You can add code to the questions
texts.quiz_info_6: You can add code to a question like this
texts.quiz_info_8: Or like this to an incorrect one
texts.quiz_info_9: You can add images, audio, or video to your questions
texts.quiz_info_10: You can add images in a question or an answer
texts.quiz_info_11: Similarly, audio files in formats like
texts.quiz_info_12: Or video files in formats like
texts.quiz_info_13: You can add an open-ended question like this
texts.quiz_info_14: Here's an example of a correct answer
texts.quiz_info_file_6: Adding 3 to 5 gives 8 (I think) as the sum of those numbers
texts.quiz_info_file_7: Which of the following are programming languages?
texts.quiz_info_file_17: A first level heading is created - the text will be displayed in a larger and bold font
texts.quiz_info_file_18: How do I display the message "Hello, World!" in JavaScript?
texts.quiz_info_file_19: This is the correct JavaScript syntax for displaying text in the console because that's what the documentation says
texts.quiz_info_file_20: What do you hear in the recording?
texts.quiz_info_file_21: Describe your day, your first day in prison
texts.quiz_info_file_22: I never wanted to end up here
